Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ggncally84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past Wednesday for one night with my boyfriend for work (we both live in Florence). We had a small superior room with the shower and double bed and it was perfect for our needs. I absolutely don't mind a shower when its got an elephant showerhead. Looking out the window there was a beautiful balcony covered in plants and small sculptures which was nice. When we came in they showed us the ruins inside the hotel which were stunning and brought us some juice. We had breakfast included which was nice, I don't think it was worth 15 euros to be honest, its a little weird to have bacon and hot-dogs but no eggs? I read here that they make scrambled eggs but that was never offered to us. it was nicely presented but we both felt breakfast was lacking and for the style and rank of the hotel, it should be amazing. Besides that, the people who worked there were really nice and we felt very welcome. For the price, I may stay in the sister location by the Spanish steps next time but it was a cute hotel. The fact they had sky was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience, lovely hotel and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Oleg42
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful and friendly staff, made our stay (with 2 small kids) wonderful. Beautiful rooms with very comfortable beds. And did I mention that the service is great? - Oleg

Reviews.Title: “Everything I was hoping for and more!”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. I was looking for somewhere to stay in the heart of Ancient Rome and The Inn at the Roman Forum looked like a good choice. When we arrived we were greeted with a warm welcome, and the hotel and the room was as lovely as it looked on the website. The room was very clean and it was kept that way throughout our stay. The staff were very helpful and always made sure we were well looked after, as well as recommending some fantastic places to eat in the evening. This is a great place to start your Roman adventure from and a very comfotable place to sleep after a long days exploring. I will definately be going back in the future and would recommend this place to anyone that prefers a very personal quality service and doesn't like big modern ostentatious hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience. Been to Rome many times - this place is great!”
Reviews.Author: 67bevil
Reviews.Content: if you look at any hotel you will find negative reviews. That is life. This place has it all and more. Great amenities (THEY HAVE ROMAN RUINS IN THE HOTEL - ASK WHERE THE DOOR GOES BEHIND THE DESK!!). Great food, great rooms! Great location. What else do you need. You get more than what you pay for here.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: ScottCarenJack
Reviews.Content: Stay on the top floor and enjoy your own garden !! Nice view of the Forum from the rooftop breakfast area. The folks running this place were charming and gracious. On a quiet street ( we saw Woody Allen filming a movie in front one day) near all the great sights. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An unpretentious home from home”
Reviews.Author: vlm75
Reviews.Content: Despite not giving this hotel a 5 star review, I'd stay here again at the drop of a hat. When you finally manage to find the hotel (only an open front door and small brass plaque mark the spot), it's absolutely lovely. The staff are friendly, efficient and helpful - especially the reception staff who ensured that all requests were dealt with quickly and made a great recommendation for where to eat (La Taverna dei Fori Imperiali, which is just around the corner and definitely worth a visit or two). There were lots of 5* touches - the hotel itself and its great location (5 mins from the Colosseum), the drink and fruit on arrival, the notes left in the room, and the lovely lounge room and terrace, the towels being replaced very regularly and the unrequested turndown service. We were in room 301 (the brown stripy 'executive' room), which was a good size and everything was in good condition - and importantly, the huge bed was really comfy. There were just a few (albeit minor) things that left a little room for improvement. Breakfast was a bit haphazard (but maybe that's just the Italian way..), you had to get hold of the waitress (sometimes a little elusive) to get coffee / tea and we didn't know until our second day that she offered what turned out to be very nice scrambled eggs, and cooked items seemed to disappear surprisingly quickly given the very limited number of guests. Although minor, little things like the ironing board being little more than a metal frame and one of the dressing gowns having seen much better days (when compared to the fluffy embroidered one from the day before) were made all the more obvious because everything else was so nice. The hotel can book taxi services for you from between the hotel and airport, we just booked online with click airport transfer for 80 euros (2 people, 2 medium and 2 small cases) and it took about 45 mins. A good professional service - in a mercedes sedan for a few euros more than the shuttle bus transfers available - definitely worth considering. All in all, I'd have no hesitations about going back to the Inn at the Roman Forum - we booked via lastminute.com and I think it's probably true in this case that you get what you pay for - but in my opinion it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis, but only steps from city center attractions”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: We spent a nice weekend at the Inn at the Roman Forum in a deluxe room. The Inn itself is a quiet oasis from the hustle and bustle of Rome, but it is just meters from the major attractions in the city center as well as Metro connections. It's location is both a curse and a blessing, as cab drivers have a little trouble finding it, and even those who know where it is have to leave you off a few steps from, and out of sight of the discrete entrance. The deluxe room was spacious, with a jacuzzi tub, and a large screen TV with many channels in English. The breakfast buffet was surprisingly nice, and the rooftop garden was a lovely place to enjoy it. The same garden was home to evening aperitifs, and served as a reading room/lounge during the rest of the day. Only a few little hiccups kept me from giving 5 stars--all of which were, however, addressed immediately by the staff. The staff were extremely helpful, most especially Ivano at the front desk. Having been to Rome on several occasions, I was not surprised by the price, but some might be taken aback a bit by the bill. For my money the experience was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: AberdeenAdvocate
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel of its type, tucked away in a quiet back street but still in the city centre. Our room was fine, very much in the Italian style which isnt to everyones liking but we liked it. Our bed was very comfy. The staff were brilliant, couldnt fault them and there is a wonderful terrace up the top of the hotel to sit and look out over the incredible view and watch the sun go down with a nice glass of prosecco!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Travelpig2
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here as a surprise trip to Rome. We travel a lot and have stayed in a lot of different hotels and a lot of boutique ones too. For the price I paid, this hotel was incredibly disappointing. The room decor was over styled and tacky, poor quality furnishings, the grouting in the bathroom was mouldy.the breakfast was a tray of soggy scrambled eggs. I ordered a coffee a couple of times and it never arrived. Breakfast was manned by one man in a cupboard off the lounge with a microwave and (although nice people) the training and professionalism of the staff was well below expectations. I am happy to stay in 'cheap and cheerful' but when I pay such prices I expect a hell of a lot more. We had a lovely holiday but it really was overshadowed by such a disappointing hotel. I will not stay there again and would discourage anyone else from staying.

Reviews.Title: “Good, just Good.”
Reviews.Author: MEMBER23
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights in a 4th floor room at the Inn at the Roman Forum. I'm still a bit suprised the hotel is noted as a 5 star estabilishement. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is nice, clean, and the staff was attentive. But, our bed may have been one of the most uncomfortable beds I have ever slept on. Additionally, the foam pillows on the bed were just bad. We had noisy neighbors in the adjoining room & it seemed like the walls were paper thin. Now, more of the good- the location is very good; it's on a side street away from traffic and it's a very short walk to the Colisseum as well as many other attractions. The wi-fi worked as promised and our car was waiting for us at the airport when we arrived. The garden area outside our 4th floor room was also a very nice touch. Bottom line for me is: I liked the hotel (liked), but would consider staying somewhere else in the future due to the noise from the adjoining room and uncomfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “An abundance of character - superb service!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_OffTheBeatenPath
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay here; the Inn made what was a rather disappointing trip (due to uncharacteristic snowy weather) much for enjoyable. To start, the inn is gorgeous in its decor throughout, and the cryptoporticus behind the reception was fascinating. Our room (401) was on the top floor with direct access to the garden. Other than some hedges requiring minor pruning (in order to get to the garden without getting touched) the garden was gorgeous - shame it was covered in snow for 3/5 days we were there. Our room was very comfortable with the most gigantic bed I have ever seen - maybe a California King? The bed linens were actually linen - a lovely touch. I would have preferred a duvet to a comforter (for hygiene reasons - duvet covers are removable), but the bedding was very attractive. The wrought iron canopy bed was adorned with curtains, the walls were fabric covered and the chandelier added wonder sparkle and elegance. I also liked the eclectic blend of furnishings. The 5 piece bath was very nice, the jacuzzi tub was fantastic and I made good use of it. The only drawback for this specific room was a ventilation issue, so the bathroom would get and stay very humid. There is a window in the bathroom, but since it was around 0 C/30 F, we couldn't open it for long without getting too cold. As a result of the humidity, there are some mould issues that need to be addressed - this is my only complaint of any weight (although the service more than made up for this). The breakfast buffet was very nice - we usually did not get hungry until about 2pm because we had plenty to eat before venturing off. The evening spread was also fantastic - between the late lunches and the bad weather, 3 of the five nights I just ate a light snack there rather than going out for dinner (I also don't like dining late in the evening). The location is fab - easy walk to the Forum, Trjan's Market, Colosseum and the Coloseo Metro station. I would recommend taking advantage of the car services if you are flying into Rome - Taxi is 40 Euro (plus 1 Euro per bag) or the car service is 50 Euro and you have recourse if anything goes wrong (i.e. corrupt cab drivers). The internet was liable - the code systems was a little annoying, but made sense since this way you pay for 24 hours of actual usage (and not a 24 hour window of time). I loved this place, I will be back. And while all the staff were excellent, a special nod to Ruby who took excellent care of us and made me feel very special.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, individual hotel in the midst of history”
Reviews.Author: RosDrake
Reviews.Content: Both myself and my fiancé loved our experience of staying in this funky hotel. The entrance was a fab start with its Roman artefacts and modern décor. Our room was beautifully decorated and overlooked an internal garden. Being able to go through the reception to walk along excavated Roman tunnels was incredible. I much prefer to stay in hotels with character, where each room is decorated differently and has some history and you get all this at The Inn at the Forum. We were able to speak to the hotel manager about the possibility of using this hotel as our main hotel for our wedding party and I am very excited about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived at the hotel we emailed ahead to see if we could drop our luggage off before check-in allowing us free to explore the city quickly. The response back itself was warm and welcoming and really set our expectations for a fantastic stay, we weren't disappointed. The service from Ruby, Ivano and the others was great. The hotel itself is tucked away on a quiet street no more then a stones throw from some very impressive roman ruins and Trajan's Market. Around the corner and less then five minutes away you’re at the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. It's in a great location!! A twenty minute walk and your inside the Pantheon and the heart of the city itself. The rooms were well decorated, clean, and comfortable with hot/cold air conditioning and a really comfy bed. The bathroom as well was equally well appointed, clean and well maintained. Breakfast in the morning is served on the fourth floor and is continental, not to our particular liking but there was something there for everyone. On the second day we had fresh scrambled egg made for us along with a Caffe Latte that was fantastic. The garden and terrace when we visited were covered in snow but offered a lovely view over the ruins and the garden offers a quiet and tranquil place to relax completely forgetting your in a city at all. Overall a fantastic hotel, tucked away in the heart of Rome which has everything to offer for those looking to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jamieson81
Reviews.Content: The inn is in a great location easy to walk to most places in Rome, lovely decor in the rooms clean and quiet. I will be visiting again

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: sibelletorres
Reviews.Content: The hotel is definitely charming, the staff is friendly and they all speak english. The breakfast is served in the terrace, which has an amazing view! My only problem with this hotel was they gave us a room which was outside the hotel, a few houses away. Although the room was really nice (seemed like a small flat), it killed the charm of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon dream”
Reviews.Author: samsung80
Reviews.Content: We were here for 4 days as a part of our honeymoon. The hotel has one of the best location in town with 10min walk to the tourist attraction meaning you could also experience the distance of being were the real Romans live that is often hard to find as a tourist. Restaurants in Monti area are different than elsewhere in Rome and we must say that it made our stay perfect. Sunday at lunch we ate in one of these places near the hotel full of italian families just wonderful experience. The service at the hotel was really good and no other hotel I have been to take such a good care of their clients if you need their assistance. Room was big for European standard and the decor was very nice. Evening snack was perfect to warm up for night out in the city with few drinks from the bar. We loved our stay here and would love to come back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Personal Attention, Comfort and View”
Reviews.Author: danryan62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem, literally 5 minutes to the Colosseum, Roman Forum, and Colosseo and Cavour Metro stations. The hotel is nicely appointed with larger than usual, comfortable rooms. The real difference maker is the helpfulness of the very attentive staff. From the very first e-mail, they made the effort to understand the needs/desires of our family during our visit to Rome. They made great suggestions for restaurants, tours, arranged drivers, etc. We had a family of 7 and occupied the 3rd floor in 3 rooms. The rooms are not connected, but basically across the hall from one another and served us well. One flight up on the 4th floor is the breakfast/lounge area. Don't miss the evening appetizers and go out on the rooftop for a stunning sunset view of Rome. Also on the 4th floor are two exquisite rooms that feature their own rooftop gardens. Since they were unoccupied during our stay, we toured them and I would highly recommend for a relaxing stay in a very busy city. Our only negatives were a very intermittent wifi service and some lobby construction which was just a matter of timing. We will return to The the Inn at the Roman Forum.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and THE BEST location”
Reviews.Author: meluzziNY
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome many times and love the city. This is without the best location you can get being walking distance to everything but still so private in this hidden away street behind the Roman Forum. Here you will feel the real spirit of Roman life and not the touristy area such as the Spanish Steps or other parts. You will eat with Romans on nearby trattoria's and it's than were you figure how amazing this hotel really is. In a very small street with only 12rooms amazing terrace, garden and lounge area. Our room was wondeful with the most powefull shower we have ever had. Clean with duvet on bed. Breakfast was good with buffet full of option. As other guest has also mentioned we ordered a wake up call the night before and they asked if we wanted coffee in bed. Early morning we got fresh coffe as promised! Great thing to get ready for an early fllight. Ask the ladies at the desk for some local places to eat in the area they know them all. Next time in Rome I know where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wake up call with coffee and muffin..great stay!”
Reviews.Author: pedroportof
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start with how happy we were booking this hotel. The airline lost our luggage so we had a bad start but once we arrived to the hotel the girl at the front desk made all phone calls and our luggage was there by the end of the night. They offered us an upgrade to higher room category that we paid happily as the room offered was very nice. All of the staff was amazing and we never have receive such high level of service anywhere else. The hotel is clean and has nice decor and great view from the roof top. On our departure day they arranged a private driver for us but the most nicest was the coffe and the warm muffin they brought to our room at 6am 5min after our wake up call. We will reccoment this hotel. Pedro & Nicky

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: lundfesten
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the new year in Rome and we found very good deal on their webpage. The room it self was nice with big flat TV and comfy bed. Everything was very clean and the breakfast buffet was full of all kinds of food. Salami, ham, cheese and fruit. Italians eat sweets in the mornings so you could have cornetto italian style. The staff was polite and helpful and the location one of the best in Rome. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok ...”
Reviews.Author: bubuzh
Reviews.Content: We spent just a night at the Inn. I can hardly believe that this hotel is in the top ten. The room is ok. Nothing special about it and so is the bathroom. Not very clean either. Found long dark hairs on the Floor. But i have to say that its very very quiet. You can not hear anything at night. Wich is very unusal for a city like Rome where they drive throug the tyniest litte streets with the cars. Breakfast Room ist very nice but the buffet not very rich. I would expect more for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Charming rooms, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: travelmaven52
Reviews.Content: We were very, very happy with our stay at this hotel. Not only is the hotel fantastic, but the location is perfect! Before we arrived, the hotel staff contacted us and asked if they could help with tours, restaurants reservations, etc. They were very prompt about replying and answered many questions over numerous emails and gave us perfect recommendations. The entire staff is wonderful, from the front desk to the bellboy/servers. Nothing but smiles and helpfulness. We were very impressed. I have never had such a great experience with a hotel in all my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Quite satisfactory but we'll probably choose a different hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: Carol_Isles
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from an eight-night stay. We had reserved a deluxe double room and were upgraded to an executive room, which was large and comfortable. The hotel's location was perfect for exploring the forums and there were several excellent and reasonably priced restaurants in the neighborhood, as well as an excellent wine bar. The street was very quiet, so we slept well. The reasons we'll look for a different hotel on our next trip to Rome are fairly minor. Our room was quite dark, even when we had all the lamps turned on and the draperies pushed back. The arrangements in the breakfast room were awkward; the tables were so low that so one had to balance plates and bowls on one's lap. The staff, though friendly and helpful, seemed inexperienced and some didn't seem to speak Italian (disappointing for me since I'm trying to learn Italian and look for every opportunity to practice speaking). We didn't feel terribly confident asking the staff for service, after we requested a taxi one evening and it never showed up, and after we asked the location of nearby ATMs and were sent on a long and fruitless expedition to Via Nazionale (we later found that the nearest functioning ATMs were quite close to the hotel, in Piazza Venezia).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: addismith
Reviews.Content: me and my girlfriend had a great stay here. I must write about the service we received. My girlfriend wanted to surprise me with football tickets and that including wine bottle and roses were added in our room upon arrival. We loved all about this small hotel, from the room itself to the common area such as one on the top floor. Great breakfast and happy hour buffet in the afternoon. On our departure day we had early departure and including our wake up call they brought us fresh coffe in the room at 6am! Great service, well done.

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay”
Reviews.Author: jonsson64
Reviews.Content: Me and my family were very happy with our stay here. This is very special place and located on perfect spot to visit Rome. Front desk girls were helpful booking us tours and guides so we saw evertthing in 2 days. They took care of booking a car back to the airport that was very nice. We had two rooms side by side that was perfect for our arrangement. The hotel is small so each floor only have 3 rooms. Breakfast had nice settings and was rich of all kind of pasteries. We will for sure be back.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away gem!”
Reviews.Author: PeterLondonW9
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel to celebrate my partner's 40th birthday after reading the excellent reviews on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed once the car arranged through the hotel had actually found the correct address! The hotel is tucked away in a very quiet street but so close to the centre of ancient Rome. Once inside and away from the searing heat of Rome in August you appreciated the tasteful decor and great service. Breakfast on the roof terrace was a delight. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonsimlans45
Reviews.Content: I travel alot for work and this time I had to do business in the center of Rome for few days. I found a great deal on their website. The room was good size had a desk with good light and high speed internet in the whole hotel. The front desk staff printed everything I sent them and sent up to my room! I would stay here again and finding such a good rate online was great to.

Reviews.Title: “Wake up call with cappucino, great service”
Reviews.Author: gustafsonhok
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for our honeymoon and we wished we could have stayed longer. We had amazing room with californian king size bed, jacuzzi and nice shower. Loved the internal decor and the lounge area. We asked for a wake up call one morning before our tour and 5min later had 2 coffee in bed to wake us up! What amazing small thing that show how good care they took of us. The lady at the front desk booked us a airport service that came right on time. We did a private tour arranged by the hotel, we liked that as it gave us so much more out of the visit. We found our new top place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “small elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelley b
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Inn at the Roman Forum. The neighborhood was so nice, easy to walk around and get to all the major sights. The hotel was small, and intimate but the rooms were very nice and spacious. There was a beautiful upstairs garden where you could have breakfast, and drinks. It was quite unique and felt as though you were in a private villa. The staff was helpful, and courteous, made reservations at restaurants and in general would help in any way they could. The hotel was on the expensive side so I did feel that at the happy hour although there were appetizers put out the drinks (I only had mineral water) could have been gratis.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: todishill
Reviews.Content: We had booked two rooms, both classic and we found them both great. Being in the historical part of Rome we found the hotel to be a perfect fit in to the area. We knew we were not in the US so the room size was no issue for us, not smaller than any other European hotel. The shower in the room was very powerful and the bed was comfy and the room it self was clean and modern designed. Breakfast was great served on the top floor with nice staff. The front desk staff was fluent english speaking and did make a great team getting us taxi, booking restaurant, printing boarding pass and just name it! We don't understand anyone having issue with staying here, maybe if you are looking for a doorman, restaurant and huge lobby than stay away! Thanks to all for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5*, nor an SLH, nor 4* really. Rooms v disappointing. Good location”
Reviews.Author: vb_cp
Reviews.Content: The plus: + Small roman ruins indoor + Good location + Quiet + Friendly & efficient housekeeping staff + Evening snack offered at 5pm The minus: - Some rooms are studios in *another building*! - Quality of sleep: not good - Some large beds: twin beds sticked together (hence you drop in the hole in the middle) - Style OK but not amazing (certainly not even close to Slh level) - Breakfast: barely 3*, juices are made of untasty concentrate, bread is frozen, etc... - Service OK: polite, but sometimes you really don't feel welcome (except with Asian members of staff) - HEATING problems: In December, our room was heated like a sauna. No joke, minimum 27*C with both windows wide open - After 3 requests, and switching off the heater, we realized it was due to an underfloor heating (which they certainly knew), it took them 48hours to accept to move us to another room - the (Basic) room offered was outrageous: appallingly old, minuscule with outdated bad decorated - an upgraded bedroom was OK, nothing fancy Overall, if you get an amazing deal you would probably be OK staying there, location being really central... however this hotel should never be allowed to hold the SLH brand, they do not qualify, by any standards, and seriously soil SLH's brand trustworthiness.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you choose the right room”
Reviews.Author: Chaffar
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is absolutely perfect, but be careful when booking a room - the amount you pay is a good hint on what to expect, which is a bit counter intuitive when you go for an SLH.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ThsTari
Reviews.Content: Perfect stay at the Inn at the Roman Forum! The executive room (kindly upgraded for a superior one paid) was beautiful and the service devoted.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel nearby the roman forum !”
Reviews.Author: sproetje2509
Reviews.Content: Liked this hotel al lot, nice room, friendly staff Good breakfast, just not so easy to sit down in the sofa and eating on a low table, in the summer you can eat outside on a normal table, this is much better. The hotel is perfectly situated, close to the roman fourm, the colesseum, even the trevi fontana and the spanish steps are easily to reach by feet. terrace with a nice view I recommand this hotel for exploring Rome, i will certainly visit it agian !

Reviews.Title: “Great family rooms”
Reviews.Author: bmwporta79
Reviews.Content: We had booked a family room option having 2 separate rooms door to door. This was perfect for us traveling with our two children (12 and 7). Like this we could have our privacy but knowing our children to be next room. The location was great and you are in the middle of the city centre. Breakfast was full of varity from tipical italian cornetti to bread, salami, cheese and fruit. Ruby was great organizing restaurants and transportation for all of us. We are booking this hotel again for our June visit to Italy with 1 day stop in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hide away in heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TLLONDON21
Reviews.Content: We found this place through Luxe Guides and very glad we did. Located just minutes from the Forum and the Colesseum it's on a tiny, steep street tucked away behind the main road. It's a b&b essentially but very good quality and part of small luxury hotels of the world. It has a bar which also serves as the breakfast room (buffet style) and two roof gardens. We were upgraded and lucky enough to get one of the rooms with its own little private garden.The room was a very good size with a huge double bed - super king at least! - and good size bathroom with jacuzzi bath, twin basins. Each room is individually and tastefully decorated, has air con, kettle and mini bar. Staff were charming and helpful and all spoke excellent English. Would thoroughly recommend it and definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MrshappySevenoaks
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly hotel and lovely bedroom on 1st floor with 4 poster bed. Ruby was very helpful in finding us good places to eat at night - all within easy walking distance after long days walking around Rome. Our only complaint would be about the waiter at breakfast who's mobile phone kept constantly going off whilst he was serving but other than that everything was very nice. Unfortunately our trip was rather spoilt after being mugged near the hotel after we'd only just arrived in Rome but I guess there are thieves everywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “A stunning boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ama1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 1 night with friends who had been before and recommended it as the best place to stay in Rome and we absolutely loved it. The Inn is hidden away down a side road and the discreet entrance gives the impression of entering a private home and that is how we were made to feel by the excellent staff...like we were honoured guests in their home. The rooms are beautifully appointed and extremely comfortable. We had a room on the second floor that had the biggest bed I have ever had in a hotel and our friends had one of the garden rooms on the fourth floor that was amazing. We absolutely loved the lounge and patio on the fourth floor and the views over the top of the forum were spectacular. The location was perfect and we could walk to most of the major attractions easily. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, especially if you are looking for a relaxing and/or romantic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TMacDonnacha
Reviews.Content: Inn at Roman Forum was well located close to the Colosseum, the breakfast area was beautiful and the staff were helpful and had good recommendations however we were a little let down by the standard of room we were paying for even tho it was not peak season, the prices for drinks in rooftop bar were also disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gemma S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly stunning. Small but perfectly formed, the staff were exceptional - we had a problem when checking in as they didn't have our reservation which devastated me as it was mine and my husbands first wedding anniversary, but the two ladies on reception could not do enough and managed to get everything sorted for us even arranged and paid for a taxi to take us to the other hotel, it did mean transferring to The Inn at the Roman Forums sister hotel The Inn at the Spanish Steps - See seperate review. The room was spotless, the bathroom with Jacuzzi bath was exceptional and the bed was really comfortable. We only ate breakfast there once, and it was fine, too many sweet things for my liking such as doughnuts??!!! they did have cold meats and cheese and some cereals and yoghurt so that was more suitable for a fussy Brit like myself. The location of the hotel is in one word FANTASTIC you are no more than a 7 minute walk to ALL of the attractions, Colosseum, Roman Forum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain etc, the roof terrace is smaller than that of its sister hotel and only 2 couples can fit up there as there aren't many chairs. Other than that I would definately return if only for its location and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at the Roman Forum”
Reviews.Author: Anthony M
Reviews.Content: WE had the pleasure of spending at evening at the Inn during a recent visit to Italy. The rooms were great and the staff were very helpful. We were able to check in early after a long flight from the US which just made our arrival and day in Rome all the more enjoyable. The location of the hotel is perfect for seeing the sights throughout Rome. The only negative was that parking was nearly impossible and the hotel was very difficult to find. Once overcome, this was a great place to stay. We will visit with them again upon a return visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Minutes from the ruins, lovely rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: samnad_bos
Reviews.Content: This was our favorite hotel stay in Italy. The rooms were nicely decorated in a very modern, funky style, the jacuzzi was a god-send after a long day of walking around the city. The lighting was a little poor but really not a big deal.The location is the best thing about this hotel, it took us minutes to walk to the Forum and the Colosseum and its about a 20 minute walk to the train station but its tucked away into a quaint street so its quiet and away from the main traffic. Staff went out of their way at the front desk, really friendly and accommodating. We really loved this little luxury hotel and there is no question where we would stay on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: hurndog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Inn from October 11-13, 2011, in an executive room on the first floor (what I would call the second floor). The hotel and room were very nice, clean and well maintained and we really enjoyed the roof terrace, garden and archaeological site on the main floor. Breakfast was also good. The staff, particularly Hildur, was very friendly and efficient. Location was excellent. My husband was impressed with the two phase toilet flushing--very efficient and not seen here in the States! My only (minor) issues were the poor lighting in the room, which made it difficult to read, and the need for more than one trashcan in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Phillip T
Reviews.Content: It's our first trip to Rome, and we chose to stay at the hotel since it's close to the Colosseum, and the Forum. We had to say the staffs were joyful and helpful. The place was quiet, and it's at dead-end street. We had one of the larger room on the third floor, it's spacious but it's lack of useful things like a working table, or a chaise like other 4star hotels. The light decoration was not practical, dark. We were not able to watch TV unless we had to lay down on the foundation bed. Nevertheless, we enjoyed the staffs, who took care breakfast and snacks on the fourth floor. They were cheerful, helpful, and dependable. In short, we recommend this hotel base on its location, and staff service. The hotel value and its rooms could be improved so it could earn 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Quiet, ideal position and Unique”
Reviews.Author: LadesClimping
Reviews.Content: Everything in Rome is expensive and whilst this hotel is no exception it is very good value for money too. From the moment of booking this hotel I was not disappointed with personalised e mails confirming my reservation and acknowledging personal requests for room selection. On arrival( yes its a bit tricky to find, but 20 mins walk from Termini station ) we were welcomed with a fruit juice drink whilst allowing us to wander the hotel's own ruins whilst awaiting check in completion. We were then informed of our upgrade to executive room( amazing, with one of the biggest beds ever laid eyes on let alone laid in) and were led to the room.This hotel only has 13 rooms but I have to say our room was elegantly decorated with plush furnishings, with all the usual and to be expected personal little luxuries. Robes slippers and mini bar.... and good old English breakfast tea together with a plethora of flavoured teas! The room was set on the second floor at the front of the hotel and was very quiet indeed. The roof terrace was beautifully laid out, even in Autumn October. There was a complementary buffet each afternoon with the purchase of a drink and I ahve to say the cost again was reasonable. There is free wifi in hotel lobby useful for pre booking tickets and skipping long queues for teh Vatican and the most friendly and helpful staff members from start to finish. The hotel is set just 10 minute walk to Colusseum, Forum and Palatine and about 15 to Trevi. It really is ideally located whilst being set peacefully away from hustle and bustle. If you dont need meeting rooms, conference facilities, gymn, sauna or pool...this really is the hotel for you. You wont be disappointed and personally in my top 10 favorites across Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, amazingly unique!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin T
Reviews.Content: One of the most unique places I've stayed in Europe. A hotel with its own ruin is pretty hard to come by. The rooms each have a unique, but extremely well-designed decor and are very spacious for such an urban location. Speaking of location, it's about a 2 block walk to the Colosseum and half that to the Forum. Also, the rooftop lounge, patio and garden area are a nice oasis that gives an open-air feeling rare in a city like Rome. Alll this is great, but the service at the hotel was truly top notch. I would expect this to be the case during the stay, but I was really surprised at the service after my stay: I left some belongings in my room, and they were promptly mailed to me free of charge (overseas, I might add) and with a very helpful attitude on top. Can;t wait to stay at the Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, most enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: SwannaUk
Reviews.Content: We have recently come back from Rome. We were celebrating our first wedding anniversary. We stayed at the Inn at the roman forum. We have read a few negative comments relating to the staff being rude etc. Please let me put this straight.We had a bit of a booking incident where we turned up to find they had no idea who we were (blame thomas cook for that one) The girls on reception were fantastic they sat with us on the phone trying to call England to find out where the bookings were for hours getting the we value your call speech from the Thomas cook customer service line.But eventually we got it sorted out all thanks to the staff, we did lose our choice of our rooms but the one we got was small but really nice.The best thing about this hotel is the location.We were litrally 2 mins walk from the forum and we had seen 4 of the big sites in about 2 hours.I would recoment this hotel to others going to rome.While you are there also check out their sister hotel inn at the Spanish steps, which is a 10 second walk to the spanish steps and is located in the high end shopping area which we took full advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “location, location and more”
Reviews.Author: MarkfromBerkeley
Reviews.Content: What a delight, hidden away in a location second to none. Quiet, elegant and attentive to guests' needs. Easy walking distance to some of Rome's greatest sights (The Collosseum, Forum and more) as well as to the "untouristed" local scene. An added bonus is an actual Roman structure on site. A little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service, Location, Room Quality”
Reviews.Author: Edpowell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk away from the Roman Forum, behind the Forum of Augustus and Trajan's Market. Every aspect of this hotel is outstanding. It is up a small hill from the forum on a cobblestone road that can only be maneuvered by the cleverest of Roman drivers as it has step at one end of the road. On arrival you are greeted at the desk by one of the two most helpful people we met in our entire stay, Hildur (day) or Angie (evening). I can't imagine how we would have managed our trip without the help of these two women. They advised us on locations to see, times to go; they helped us make reservations, buy tickets. They recommended tours for us, including a spectacular guided tour in a beautiful air-conditioned Mercedes that allowed us to see in one day what it would take most people a week to see. They arranged for our special needs. They bought us groceries from a local store that we needed for snacks. They clued us in to the best nearby restaurants. They were, in fact, the heroes of our vacation, along with all the other excellent staff at the Inn. We arranged to get into the room early so we had a place to crash at 11am following a flight. The Innprovided us with free airport transportation since we were staying 5 nights. The room was an "Executive" at the front of the hotel, was very large with a great couch to lay down on, and a great sitting area with a desk. The bed was a king and, in my only complaint, somewhat firmer than I prefer. The room was decorated pleasantly, with great wood ceilings and a fireplace. The wifi worked (mostly), and they lent us a laptop one evening so we could watch a DVD be purchased at one of the sites. The roof-top garden and terrace was extremely pleasant, as was the common room. The breakfast was good, with fruits, meats, cheeses, but especially eggs and bacon. Yay! There is a small elevator, which helped my wife, since she is not as mobile as I am. The bell staff, especially Elmer, was extremely helpful in getting our bags in and out, and running errands for us, and helping out whenever we needed something. Everyone was friendly, addressed us by name, talked to us when we needed someone to talk to, and made our stay in Rome truly wonderful. In all honestly, if it weren't for Hildur and Angie, our vacation would have been only a fraction as great as it ended up being. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent Hotel (not for the guests with limited mobility)”
Reviews.Author: Sailing4
Reviews.Content: This is a very good location (residential) to stay at in Rome. Very close to The Forum and other sites. The hotel was very quiet – for Rome. The small English speaking staff was very nice and helpful.Only one person on the small front desk, which is manned 24 hours a day. All emails with questions were answered promptly. Nice good sized room with good air conditioner, we were upgraded on arrival to a larger room than standard. Roof top terrace and bar was pleasant with a good breakfast and afternoon snacks. There are 2-4 steps up and down in many parts of the hotel, which is located on a fairly step uphill dead end street where it becomes steps down to another street. It is a short walk to major thoroughfare for taxis and restaurants. No full restaurant but very limited room service menu in hotel. There is a decent restaurant at the bottom of the hill.(short walk). After a full day of sightseeing nice quiet hotel to come back to with a cheerful greeting from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique, comfortable, great location...”
Reviews.Author: SEW724
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this boutique hotel while in Rome in August for 3 nights, A small beautiful hotel with a great room, large bath and breakfast is available every morning, A lovely roof top deck overlooking the Roman Forum and "wedding cake", an intimate top floor lounge for evening appetizers or breakfast and a little private catacomb all add up to a sensational place to stay. Off the main roads with no traffic noise, great location for walking around Rome and sensational staff. The staff helped us in finding a great seafood restaurant and helped me to locate a camera shop. We would certainly stay here again and would recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Paula F
Reviews.Content: We recently booked the Master Garden Suite. From the moment we arrived until we left the staff were pleasant and very helpful. Breakfast was fine, you have to buy a drink to access the free afternoon snack bar, which we had no problem with. The location is fantastic, a walk to everything, go early to beat crowds and go on a guided tour at coliseum, they will approach you outside and it is well worth it, our two guides were fabulous. Hit the back alleys and watch the cars and scooters! Would love to return again. Paula and Rick from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent visit”
Reviews.Author: erbostondoc
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived a staff member opened the door I was treated like a valued guest. Staff at the front desk were gracious, helpul and kind. The complimentary turn down service was welcomed pampering. The bed was very comfortable and the lounge was great area to relax and work on the computer. I look forward to return to this Inn!

Reviews.Title: “why such a poor breakfast at such a good hotel?”
Reviews.Author: philimarr
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel is perfectly situated near the forum and the coliseum, quiet and comfortable. Here no remarks at all. But for the price, it is after all an expensive hotel, we could expect a minimum of fine goods when having breakfast. It was a disaster and i suspect those who wrote that it was fine to be (too) good friends of the hotelier.... No fresh juice, tree small pots of yogurt in a vase of water (previously some ice???) , eggs and bacon stewing for hours in a warm-holding container, carton tasting croissants.... etc etc... It is simple, every morning we went to a coffee shop to have a real good breakfast. We do not understand how such a good and comfortable hotel (see the introduction of my comment, can be so distasteful and so cheap, we gladly paid for "the whole experience" and did only get half of it... shame on you.... But the truth is that, if they could just learn a little bit from what the customers write, it could be one of the finest hotels in Rome. We did get a bigger room than we booked, were helped along our stay by kind and professional staff, had fresh bedding and towel every day. Therefore we would recommend the hotel to anybody, just hoping that some day the owner would understand that the final touch is an important one. Because that day we will gladly be back!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: marcstifty
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the INN last week and it was just great. The location is the quite only 2 minutes away from the Roman Forum, the are many little restaurants and bars in the area where we could seat outside, fantastic! The room was very comfortable and clean, very good bed. The breakfast is delicious and there is a beautiful terrace where you can relax and enjoy Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shaz1906_11
Reviews.Content: My daughter found this Hotel on Trip Advisor for me, while she was helping me plan a trip overseas. I booked the Hotel, and our stay was in June, 2011. The location was perfect, just a few minutes walk to the Colusseum. We also walked from there to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain Without a doubt, this Hotel was absolutely perfect. They provide a beautiful breakfast daily, as well as appetisers/afternoon tea later in the day. The room was perfect, very generous in size, and very clean. The huge bed was SOOO comfortable, and the staff were among the most helpful and pleasant that I have ever encountered. Nothing was a problem to them. If you are going to Rome, you really should book this hotel. I will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So happy!”
Reviews.Author: barretnancy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here by my self for 3 nights and what a great place to be. I had a queen size bed, jacuzzi and small balcony! The decor was nice and modern and the girls at the desk were so nice to me and gave me restaurant suggestions were I found the best lasagna ever eaten. As travelling on my own I met other wonderful guests at this Inn end we all ended up having a guide of the Roman forum organized by one of the lady at the desk! I really recommend this hotel and must say it was not that expensive compared to what I received!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: convsport67
Reviews.Content: We loved our short stay at this little hotel. We only stayed here for a night but we used the amenities and loved our garden room. We had the breakfast directly out from our room that was amazing and private. The helped us to arrange a car to the airport and a private guide (Valentina) that was great as we only had one day in the city. We would so much like to visit this propery soon and spend more time in the eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: stotheb
Reviews.Content: my wife wondered what kind of hotel i'd booked as we walked from the metro, up the cobbled street, to this hotel. but, on arrival she was very happy. the decor is stylish and unique, the location excellent. absolute must - ask staff to recommend a good quality, local restaurant. we went once, and we had to go again, by far the best food we had on the trip, and it's a v short walk from the hotel and family run. (i forget the name).

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mickylass
Reviews.Content: we had great time here, the staff were excellent, rooms a fair size for a city, very calm and comfy bed. The place is very clean and the breakfast is delicious. In a great location within walking distance from the Roman Forum and there are many little restaurants in the area. Would highly recommend thi INN.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: albagianni
Reviews.Content: This place is difficult to find the first time. In fact, our taxi driver had to ask another driver for directions! But once you arrive, it's wonderful. From the moment we walked in, whereupon we were invited to stroll through the portion of the forum contained within the hotel while they processed our reservation, we felt that we were in another world. We were upgraded to a room on the fourth floor with a small patio overlooking a garden. Sitting on that patio, looking at the trees and foliage, we could hear no noise. it was hard to believe that we were in bustling Rome. Yet, once we stepped out the front door, there we were in ancient Rome with all its noise, splendor, and history. The room was beautiful, with the largest king bed we've ever seen. Wifi reception was excellent. The bathroom and its amenities were everything you would expect in a five star hotel. The evening snack/wine break was a nice touch, and breakfast very good. You can choose to have your meals in the outdoor eating area, which has a small view of the Victor Emmanuel monument and some cupolas, or inside where there are very comfortable sofas and chairs. The staff was very helpful and gracious. They gave us very good restaurant suggestions and efficiently arranged for our airport transfer. This is not an inexpensive hotel, but having stayed at several hotels Rome, its location, amenities, and service makes it worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend break”
Reviews.Author: elkvellchristiansen
Reviews.Content: We came here for a weekend to excape the already 'cold' weather in sweden. We loved our stay, the city and the service we had at this cute little hotel. We had a bedroom with cannopy bed and a fireplace (not to be used of course) the room was amazing, AC worked very well in the september heat and the breakfast was rich of all kinds of option. We both agreed that this was the most lovelly hotel we have been to.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: gonzalcarlos789
Reviews.Content: This was a first class hotel in every way. We were surprised with a bottle of sparkling wine (we let them know this was our honeymoon). The rooom was great and the service impeccable. The location is great very near everything. Its the place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We were so pleased with everything”
Reviews.Author: norskemand78
Reviews.Content: spent a long weekend with my husband. We had very friendly check in and as we came in the afternoon they offered us a drink on the roof terrace. Everyone of the staff was top notch. Hotel was very beautiful, clean, spacious and comfortable. All requests were met with pleasantness and expeditiously fullfilled. We returned home well rested and feeling quite pampered and spoiled. Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: dimimiami
Reviews.Content: Great staff, courteous and efficient. Beautifully appointed rooms. We even had a balcony. Air conditioning worked well in warm and very himid weather. We even got a free airport pick up that was well worth it. Location great close to everything. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and great for families”
Reviews.Author: hannajons
Reviews.Content: I haven't done a review here for quite some time as nothing has compelled me to write. I must write this review as the service at this Inn is simply unmatched not beeing a 5 star hotel (so if that's what you are looking for, this is not the place). But if you are looking for a great location, good rooms, good service for families and reasonable rates, look no further. The family rooms were perfect for all 4 of us (two rooms close to each other). The staff couldn't better, friendliness all around so you feel at home. Nice touch with welcome drink, buffet breakfast, free coffee all day and snack buffet in the afternoon. Location is superb, just a block from Colosseum, very central and convenient. Overall very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at The Forum - our worst nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Babs_Kendal
Reviews.Content: Booked the Inn at the Forum for my daughter's honeymoon, they stayed 3 nights and couldn't wait to get home. The following is what they experienced. Had no sleep the first night because the bed was broken (3 broken slats and mattress springs broken on one side). Broken toilet seat. Broken tap. Peeling and mouldy wallpaper. Jacuzzi not working. Bath plug not working. Towel rail broken. Mini bar handle missing. Complained the next morning but nothing had been done by 5.00pm. Changed rooms but even worse. The air conditioning in the new room was not working and blew out hot air instead of cold. It was 39°c during our stay. Between midnight and 4.00am the temperature was unbearable and we took it in turn to take cold showers to cool down. The receptionist said it was because the room had not been used for 2 weeks. Lies - the room had not been used because the air conditioning was broken! Thank you Inn at the Forum for ruining their honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: aussy61
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in august and loved it. We flew in from Boston and from the moment we arrived it was like we were royalty! We received a fresh welcome drink and upon check in we were upgraded to a deluxe room. The hotel provide free snack with one drink from the bar (the hotel bar was not expensive compered to Rome) breakfas was lovely as well. We only had two nights here and wished it had been longer. Great hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great little world”
Reviews.Author: bostmasec
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days in august. What a great place. The location is perfect for getting around Rome. The staff was outstanding. While checking in we were given a champagne flute of fruit juice. The room was very comfortable and having it facing the roof terrace gave it a great feel. We loved the snack buffet in the afternoon. My husband is still raving about how great our stay was here. We will definitely recommend this to friends and if we stay in Rome again it will only be here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: drbillnchristi
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for its proximity to the Roman Forum, but now that we've been there, it'll be our top choice no matter what we are seeing or doing in Rome. The service was fantastic, the room was wondeful, the bed was heaven and the decor of the whole hotel was elegant but inviting. The staff consistently went out of their way to be kind and helpful. Thanks Bill and Christina - L.A

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: crtraveler2
Reviews.Content: We booked for our family of four (two children) the deluxe family room which is actually two adjacent rooms lon the same floor. We arrived in rome early in the morning and could check in early (with a fee) which was a blessing after a long overnight flight. The rooms are very spacious, nicely decorated; the beds are very comfortable. The entrance as mentioned in previous reviews is in a side alley but we had no trouble finding it with taxui from the airport. The neighborhood is quiet , appears very safe; we had no problem strollinf through the streets late in the evening with two children. The location of thehotel is superb. It is in walking distance to most of the sites to see in Rome as well as to bus and subway stations. The staff was friendly and helpful; the breakfast which was offered in the balcony on the top floor was plentiful. Surely the rates are somewhat pricey but this hotel is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “If you need a quality hotel, this is the place”
Reviews.Author: housewife77
Reviews.Content: I took my sons down to Rome for a weekend, after surfing hotels in I came down to this hotel and found a great rate for a triple room. We pre paid the room through their website as they had some discounts, and you could also book a pick up service directly with the room. Our driver (Luca) was there on time at the busy FCO airport. When we arrived we were welcomed in very nice way and told that our room had been upgraded (free of charge) wow! Our room had king size bed and sofa bed wich was great. Bathroom had jacuzzi and shower (and a great shower). The location of the hotel is perfect, directly behind Forum Romano and Colosseum. The staff were great, very helpful and polite. What a find!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and great experience”
Reviews.Author: frandiaviag
Reviews.Content: This hotel knows how to do it right. Everything from reservation to check out was first class. The room was great with bathtub and poweful shower. The front desk staff is pleasant and ultra accommadating, they printed our boarding pass, send a bottle of wine in the room, razor and foam with a smile. They are there to meet your needs with no hesitation. Highly recommend this place based on location, luxury and above all great service!

Reviews.Title: “An Ellengant suprise in Ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ohminihaha
Reviews.Content: This was a splurge for usual Rome budget . I stayed 4 days then off to Florence. The property was just as advertised, with the exception of the limo pick-up LOL. The best feature was the step out from the bedroom to a rooftop garden with lawn. Very relaxing after those long hours walking & exploring Ancient Rome. The Hotel is located and actually part of Ancient Rome. Also within walking distance to Spanish Steps and all that shopping. The roads are very, very narrow and the property entrance is on a cobblestone hill that looks like a residence. Once inside~suprise!. The staff was friendly & very helpfiul and the recommended tour guides were exceptional. I would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: eignhans
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel in perfect location in Rome. Hotel room was big and we had a family of 4 so we had the family deluxe room, good option with two separate rooms door to door. The customer service was fantastic staff could't do enough for us. Other great thing was the rooftop terrace beatiful and comfortable seating, very relaxing with white wine. Visiting Rome again I would not conider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: thomscat
Reviews.Content: We had good two night stay at this hotel. Very good check-in and out experience, professional service, room was large and comfortable with excellent shower, TV, wi-fi in the room at a payment but they offer free use of the internet in the lobby if needed. Great service as hotels in italy hardly offer free use of a computer. The AC worked very well and the snack afternoon buffet was a great way to end a hot day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tivolidk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading other peoples rocommendations and we had an awsome time. The staff was friendly and so helpful, they were able to help organise some of our tours, gave us maps and directions. The breakfas buffet was excellent and the afternoon buffet was a lovely way to start an evening. We could walk everywhere in Rome. You really can't find a better place. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Blackspur
Reviews.Content: My family and I are just back from 4 nights at the hotel and had a wonderful stay. Echoing all the other comments the staff could not be nicer or more helpful and we had a lovely room on the ground floor where my daughters bed was easily fitted in without making the room seem at all cluttered. Lovely bathroom with great jacuzzi bath which was lovely after a long days sightseeing. Fantastic location from which to explore all of the delights of Rome and what better sight could there be than the Forum every morning when you have left your hotel. Roof terrace is lovely and breakfast was fine with the evening snacks a very nice touch and a nice end to the busy day. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and only tiny complaint was the noise at end of the day as people returned and the morning as they arrived/left but this was because we were in a room next to reception and entrance. As others have said very good air conditioning which was essential with Rome touching 100F. Try Marios at bottom of the road as a cheaper alternative. Not the best meal you will ever have but good friendly service and Gavi at 20 euros a bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in the luxury hotels in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Islanda2007
Reviews.Content: I must say I was astonished by the calm luxury, tranquility and beautiful, clean and well equipped room at this jewel in the fine small hotel crown in this great city and I relaxed fully. The area is breathtaking as well. Close to the Colosseo and Forum, the hotel has it´s OWN archeological finds, wow - and I thought it was the best experience I´ve ever had at a hotel, must say it´s almost academical being there. The staff´s hospitality was great, they did everything for us and in this almost ancient, calm way. The room was so comfortable and nice that I almost forgot going out :) The buffet was very nice. Thank´s from freddo Islanda! I sure will visit you in a few year´s time again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: cassidiem78
Reviews.Content: Like lots of people we viewed this webage before choosing a hotel for our holiday in Italy. This Inn as a small boutique hotel where you were greeted by every single staff member you encountered. Our room was on the top floor with our own garden outside of the room where we had breakfast every morning. Every day we came back we found a complimentary bottle of wine waiting for us in the room. Great breakfast were served on the top floor and excellent wine and cheese selection in the evening. The added bonus was the hotel location just few steps from Roman Forum, easy walk to spanish steps, trevi fountain and the rest of the center. We never used a cab all the time with everything being easily accessible. For us it was an excellent choice of hotel, great central Rome location. This Inn will be our number one choice again should we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: travellingbrits03
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel following the good reviews on trip advisor. Firstly, you must organise a taxi for your arrival, you will notnfind this hotel unassisted! The hotel is a converted town house and do not be put off by the entrance, narrow corridor with a tiny lift, as the rooms are excellent. Large very comfortable bed, beautiful bathrooms and, very importantly, efficient air conditioning. An oasis just a stones throw from thenForum and Colleseum. Only criticism, the hand towels are traditional linen, strange for Brits. There is a lovely lounge area on the fourth floor (where a good quality cold buffet breakfast is served) which leads on to a small roof terrace. Not really suitable for sun bathing but great for exhausted tourists to have a cold glass of wine before collapsing in the air conditioned room. A massive plus though is the personal touch, the front desk could not be more helpful. Two restaurant recommendations - both great - and a guide for the forum, who was excellent, organised within 24 hours. Train timetables printed off, taxis efficiently organised etc etc. Thanks Hildur, a super service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: notavjorge
Reviews.Content: This hotel really came as a surprise. My co-worker had recommented this place and thanks to him we found this gem in the center of Rome. The entrance was small but once you go up to the rooms you understand why people love this place. The hotel is small and have only 14 rooms that is really nice so no crowd. They have these amazing roof terrace on the top floor where you can enjoy a drink or have pasta and wine for lunch or dinner. The staff was helpful and friendly. Location is top as we are basicly behind the forum area. We loved our stay so much that we hardly wanted to leave.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: AntoA
Reviews.Content: Very nice Boutique Hotel. The perfect location in Rom. Friendly and helpful staff. Discover Rome from the roof terrasse. Afternoon snack and nice breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: moriconi9
Reviews.Content: We just got home after 3 weeks trip to Italy. We agreed that this was THE BEST hotel we have been to during the entire trip. Traveling with two kids (8 & 10) we booked the Executive family room. We found it a good option to have two separate rooms so close to each other. The service was great and the hotel is located directly in the historical part of Rome. Each of our room was nicely decorated and the top floor offer terrace with a view and their own garden. We could not have been more happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjoggihall7
Reviews.Content: we really had great stay here. The hotel is very charming with only few rooms per floor. We booked executive room that was big and comfortable. We got free airport pick up as we booked directly with the hotel. The roof top terrace with the city view was amazing breakfast spot. The service provided was the best we have receive in any hotel ever been to. We really would recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: gummhof
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but good things to say about our stay here. We had a very nice deluxe room with jacuzzi bath. Staff was very helpful and booked us at a great restaurants nearby. We loved the monti area. The hotel has a small nice entrance tucked in this tipical italian street without any cars at all. We had the afternoon snack one night served at the terrace. We would stay here again when visiting Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Lika_M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was hard to find, we actually walked right past it the first time around. Its right next to the Forum, actually has some ruins in the basement - super cool :).... 5 minutes to the Colloseum... the staff was accomodating and friendly, the rooms - great, but most of all, the roof of the hotel makes you feel like you are in Tuscuny not in rome - having breakfast and night caps on the roof was the highlight of the experience! Would definately reccomend this place. Very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Service was great, location is unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: DartmouthGuy
Reviews.Content: The property has its quirks (like the oddly shaped toilet seats), but overall it's a true hidden gem in Rome. We stayed there for our honeymoon just a few days ago and were very, very happy. The daily free breakfast was much appreciated, as was the free wine we found waiting for us in our (spacious, clean, and well decorated) room one evening. It's an oasis of newness amidst some of Rome's most ancient spots. And the staff was always exceptionally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was absolutly AMAZING! Cant wait to come back again.”
Reviews.Author: bks4
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, such an awesome place and location. The workers were SO helpful, especially HILDA! We had such a fun time in Rome, and this hotel did nothing but help our experience here. We cant wait to come back again. -Brooke & Veronica from Semester at Sea!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: stardragour78
Reviews.Content: Came here with our 3 kids and had a perfect time. Big clean rooms and the breakfast and the afternoon buffet was scrumptious. Quiet and fresh place in the best location...perfect for long hot days of sightseeing. We were welcomed bt a very friendly and helpful staff along with a welcome drink! The staff gave us the best tips on how to get around and where to shop,eat and visit. Things that Romans would do too and not just the usual tourist traps. Recommemd to all types looking for a special home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Love at first sight!”
Reviews.Author: SonoSammi
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome, but definitely not the last! We love small hotels, and this is one of the best! The hotel, the staff, the location - everything was perfect! I have to highlight the staff: We have never met such service in any other hotel - and we travel a lot! Always there to answer any question, to give advices about places to eat in the neighbourhood and everything else you want to know. Always with a smile and making sure we had a good time. We had a cosy room - a little bit warm in the night though - but spacy and clean. Next time I will ask for a room with at view. Lovely breakfast on the rooftop under the parasol - no better way to start the day! All in all: Love at first sight, this hotel is a real gem! Our last night in Rome was at the Inn at the Spanish Steps - but that is another adventerous story...

Reviews.Title: “Best 1 nights visit”
Reviews.Author: ginamariadoles
Reviews.Content: We only stopped here for 1 night before going on a cruise. We have never met such a polite and amazing service as we were given. They picked us up from the airport and again took care of our transfer to the port on following day. We had two rooms and they were both just amazing. One had shower the other had jacuzzi. Their terrace was a nice way to end the day. We loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful small romantic inn - close to everything and quite -”
Reviews.Author: Petshop17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife on our honeymoon for the last 5 days of the trip. We were upgraded to the garden suite one of only 2 on the top floor (4th floor) . It was a delightful stay in a beautiful and romantic inn. The roman forum is just next door and the colosseum just up the road. In fact the hotel is excavating a roman ruin just next to the reception desk. The reception staff were very helpful, friendly and efficient and catered to all our requests. It is also very quite due to limited traffic and the rooftop gardens are beautiful and tranquil. If you can afford it, it is a highly recommended place to stay in Rome with easy access to anywhere you may want to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: allcar8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very nice find. We boooked the room directly with the hotel itself in order to get the discounts they offer. We booked a summer promo offer getting free upgrade in deluxe room and huge discount on the total price! The room was big for being in old part of Rome. This area is very nice with 5min walk to the Forum. The most amazing was their garden and terrace were we had breakfast every morning. The staff took care of our airport transfers both ways and everything else requested. We found our future Roma hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: alromeoj
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband had a great time at this amazing Inn. We booked an executive room so we received a private driver to meet us at the airport. Their roof top amenities were so lovely that we didn't want to leave for dinner almost. The service from the staff was more than you get at a top 5 star hotel, taking care of airport transfer, vatican tickets, city guide and restaurant reservations. I have no complain what so ever about our stay here. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Clean, Comfortable and A Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: TheJourneyBeginsNow
Reviews.Content: There is not enough room in this review to tell you how happy we were with The Inn At The Roman Forum. The rooms were spotless, comfortable and quiet. The bed was perfect...the lighting nice...flat screen TV...everything you could want. The bathroom was all marble with a Jacuzzi tub and shower...nice. The staff was exceptional. Hildur met us when we checked in and helped us with our every need during the stay...everything from finding and loaning us a charger adapter for our IPad, finding an Apple store for us (and printing out directions), helping us find information on specific tours and printing out the emails that we received. The location is behind at the Roman Forum so the location is perfect. The hotel even has ancient Roman ruins under the hotel that you can walk through. We have been to Rome three times and we will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Inn at the Roman Forum!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel004
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rm. 303 for 5 nights at the end of May 2011. The Inn is amazing. The location is ideal for exploring Rome. We walked to everything except Vatican City (we took a taxi). The room was extremely comfortable and quite large for Europe. It included a jacuzzi tub and large flat screen TV. Buffet breakfasts were outstanding, offering a large selection of options including scrambled eggs and bacon/ham. The service is superior from the staff at the front desk. They provided a great Rome map, dinner recommendations and reservations, and use of the PC in the lobby. The Inn offers nice happy hour snacks, also. The rooftop terrace is elegant and charming. This was by far our favorite of 3 hotels in Italy. Do not worry about the neighborhood, it is great. There was no graffiti near the hotel on our stay. By the way, Rome is covered in grafitti in many other areas of the city. We booked the car service from the airport to the Inn and pickup was on time and the ride was very comfortable. It was worth every euro! The driver brought us right to the door. You can avoid the steps at the one end of the street by traveling in the other direction. We truly loved this hotel and would highly recommend it. If we return to Rome, we won't even consider other options!

Reviews.Title: “Free airport pick up - free upgrade & internet amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: snorkbsg
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife can't say enough good words about this place. When I called to check for availability I was explained about all their website offer and thanks to that I safed huge amount on the room rate itself and not only that as they also organized a driver to meet me at the airport all inclusive with the rate. Other website don't offer these services for free. The hotel is in amazing location and our room was upgraded upon arrival. We spent good time of our trip in the garden they have on the 4th floor just amazing. We loved the service we received true 5 star treatment. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: monkeygardur
Reviews.Content: This hotel feel so much luxurious. The hotel staff was extemely helpful and kind. The jacuzzi in the room was amazing, comfortable bed, good space and nice modern decor. Beside the jacuzzi my best part of this hotel was the garden on the top floor. Breakfast was included and they had rich choise of food, cake and salami just wondeful. I can't wait to come back there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: njshore07
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the Inn at the Roman Forum, it was easily the best hotel we stayed at during our time in Italy. The service was top notch, the staff was very knowledgeable about the area and they went out of their way to help us with things such as directions and making dinner reservations. Upon checking in we were shown to the hotel's own Roman ruins and were also given a cold fresh beverage. We were shown two rooms and given our choice of the two. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel's location was very convenient to many of the sights in Rome and not too far (maybe 5 minutes walk) from a subway stop. The hotel was also tucked back in a quiet street so in addition to being convenent to all of the attractions around the ruins and the Coliseum, it was also peaceful. We took advantage of the happy hour offered each evening, and it was a nice way to relax before heading back out for dinner. The roofdeck terrace was very nice. The downsides, while small, were that instead of a double bed, we were given two singles pushed together (we found this to be true of many of the hotels we stayed in) and the AC was not yet turned on in the building so the rooms were a bit warm until late in the evening when they'd had a chance to cool naturally. Overall though, this hotel was a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Best Small Luxury hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: virginiafamily5
