There is even an ancient ruin within its walls, something that our teenaged daughter found intriguing and fun. If you can, choose rooms 401 or 402. if you travel as a family, opt for both, giving you the privacy and open air space that is so welcome after a day on the streets touring sights. There are numerous good restaurants within walking distance and a gelateria that was given high marks, even after tasting the gelato in the Piazza Navona. Truly this hotel is a gem and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Confy Rome”
Reviews.Author: promofact
Reviews.Content: I spend 4 days at this lovely Inn at the Roman Forum and i can simply said that i had a very good experience.The quality of the service was very high in terms of ospitality and simple things like resolving a Rent a car problem. I do travel a lot for business but in this particular trip i brought also my wife ( first time in Rome!!!) and she also was very happy for the atmosphere that we found in this Hotel. Way to go Piergiovanni Persone' New york - USA

Reviews.Title: “Warning - do not stay here !!!! This is not a 5 star hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: kez1969
Reviews.Content: Dear Readers My husband and I checked into this apparently 5 star hotel for a 7 day holiday. For 600 Euro's a night at this is what you can experience also:- * No assistance with bags on arrival - actually no real welcome. * Room - upgraded - is absolutely stunning. * Out side Restaurant recommendation shocking - would rather send you to a dingy cafe so that they can receive a kick back instead of the groovy well-priced family owned terrace restaurant down the hill. * A receptionist who will yell and point fingers at you quite happily if you decide not to go to the dingy places that he recommends. * Forget ordering room service - as it will be something out of the freezer which looks likes a waiter has dropped, stood on, then piled back onto the plate. You can also add in there cold and hard. * The TV/Satellite that does not work and the so called free internet that is off more than on. * Corridor flooded into the room (6 meters) when it rained and no staff to mop up water for 12 hours. * On deciding to complain to the receptionist we found out later that the man privy to our conversation was the owner / manager of the hotel. He quietly listened to our complaints behind our back but decided not to get involved or offer any assistance. * Breakfast is something a 3 star hotel would display and serve. * If you want room service the line will go to the receptionist, if you want house keeping the line will go to the receptionist, if you want concierge the line will go to the receptionist, if you want an outside line it will go to the receptionist - who then will order (whom we renamed manuel) the wee manny to run up and down serving all the clients of the hotel by himself. * I would recommend you take up smoking before you order a drink as this will give you something to do whilst you wait for your drink order. Alternatively - do what we did - check out and check into the The Grand Regis Hotel for the same price - and have a truly 5 STAR hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pity about the service”
Reviews.Author: DebDarren
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel after reading the fabulous reviews and when we arrived we were not disappointed. The location is perfect, tucked away on a cobbled lane yet literally 5 minutes walk from the collosium. We are two married couples and once in reception we were told one couple could have a room upgrade. The upgraded room was magnificent, absolutely huge with a jacuzzi bath and a rock-star style leather bed! However the second room was a real let down. We had all booked and paid for a superior double room but our room was what they describe on their website as a classic room, basically the cheapest. It was extremely small and dark, with no view at all just a wall, no fireplace and a very small bathroom with only a shower. My husband did ask if we could change room but they did not have a room available. They did say it would be reflected in the bill but we were still charged for a superior double. The service was very slow when ordering drinks on the roof terrace and Saturday early evening was particularly bad. We ordered a round of drinks, three of the drinks they had on their list they didn't have and we waited ten minutes each time for him to tell us this, when we eventually got our drinks we had waited over half an hour. For a five star hotel this was not acceptable. Overall we had a fantastic time in Rome but the hotel was not what we would class as 5 star. There wasn't even a welcoming drink when we arrived or any kind of greeting. One minute from the hotel is a typical Italian family restaurant, very simple, very friendly. The food and wine are fantastic, try and get a table outside. We will visit Rome again when our children are older but we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice In Rome”
Reviews.Author: BriSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a small and intimate with much attention to detail. The rooms are spacious by Italy standards and very well appointed. The staff are very friendly and aim to assist in any way possible. The breakfast and happy hour are a nice touch although you do have to pay for drinks. We were welcomed with a beautiful fruit basket and little gifts were left each day in our room. They really seem to care about their guests. I want to give a special thanks to Helviere and Mr Marco for making our stay so exceptional. Both of them answered all of my e-mails prior to our stay always within 24 hours; they are both very kind, courteous, and helpful. Helviere and other staff gave us great restaurant choices were the locals ate; it really gave us a true feeling of being in Rome. I highly recommend the executive room as it is really beautiful and large; well worth the price. If you are looking for a smaller hotel with much attention to your happiness, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “perfect and charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: doratReykjavik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn in April 2008. For us this was an excellent choice; all the commodities of a five star hotel and yet small and charming. We really felt like we experienced the true Rome. For those interested in history and art, you couldn't find a better accommodation as you have Roman history within the hotel walls. The cryptoport at the hotel is truly amazing - where do you find accommodation with this kind of link with the history of the city? Given the location the rooms were a delightful surprise. Large comfortable beds, cosy interior, plasma screens and all modern commodities like the iPod station - what a splendid idea! I truly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: atherapynyc
Reviews.Content: I was happy with all aspects of this hotel. The staff was very very friendly. Our room was beautiful, nice sheets, very Italian chic design. The breakfast on the roof was plentiful and served in the shade and outside. It was a total cure for jet lag. It is centrally located, walking distance from everything a tourist would like to see. No complaints whatso ever. (Ok maybe the elevator was a little small.) :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Forum Inn”
Reviews.Author: chb58
Reviews.Content: Like all the previous reviewers the location is wonderful, the amenities are top notch and the staff is excellent. The Inn is located on a very small alley/street easily missed. We were fortunate enough to have GPS to guide us in. To me the mark of a good hotel is the ability of the management staff to make decisions based on the needs of the guests. We booked our 6 night stay through the hotel website and upon arrival we were shown to a extremely small room. After a discussion with the assistant manager we were moved to a slightly larger room that fit our needs more comfortably for our stay. That decision changed the tone of our stay and made us very happy. The room was very nicely appointed plasma screen TV, comfortable bed, well lighted and a great bathroom, the bonus was the small patio located off the room. The thing about this hotel and its great location is the absolute quietness at night. It is really located in a busy section of Rome, but once in the door it is very private. Breakfast and nightly happy hour are served upstairs. Breakfast is a smorgasbord of goodies that seems to never end. Happy hour is a great assortment of meats, cheeses and nuts. Beverages are purchased separately. The staff Anthony and Pia go so far out of their way to take care of every detail. it was refreshing to meet people who are passionate about their jobs. They do them well. If we returned to Rome we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New Year's break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: fishesgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband was working nights over Christmas so as a treat we went out to Rome on New Years' Day and stayed at this wonderful hotel. It is situated 5 minutes walk from the Colosseum and 3 minutes from the Forum and is within walking distance of all of Rome's major attractions. However, it is quietly situated - we had the room on the ground floor and it was very peaceful. The hotel houses it's own Roman ruin / excavation. The room was huge and stylishly furnished with unusual touches. Wonderful bathroom with jacuzzi bath. Staff were very helpful and went out of their way to make our stay memorable with daily gifts and excellent restaurant recommendations (there is no restaurant at the hotel). Very tasty continental breakfast served in the comfortable dining room at the top of the hotel. Roof terrace looked lovely but a little cold and dark in January to enjoy it! The breakfast area is small and seemed crowded despite the hotel being only half full - wonder what it would been like at peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jsmerkle
Reviews.Content: I adored this little gem of a hotel! It's more of a boutique B&B located on a very quiet side street just steps away from the Roman Forum and the Colliseum. I was in Rome for business and was very pleased with the amenities - the desk in the junior suite wasn't large but certainly met my needs. The neighborhood was delightful, and I particularly enjoyed the restaurants that the hotel recommended which were right around the corner. Although there were a handful of other tourists there, the clientele was primarily locals which is always a good sign. I stayed in room #301 and highly, highly recommend it. I ended up having to temporarily move to room #402 (one of the rooms that overlooks the garden) due to a leak in my room, and I though room #301 was much better. Much more of a suite - it includes a sofa, two chairs and a fireplace! But in warmer weather I'm sure access to the garden would be lovely. I agree 100% with the comments from the Santa Barbara poster below. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “like home”
Reviews.Author: xm07
Reviews.Content: we spend 5 nights of our honeymoon in Rome in this little precious hotel upon arrival we were upgraded to the 402 room on the top floor with the private garden. Very nicely decorated -even if we had stayed in larger rooms- beams on the ceiling and direct access to the little beautiful garden with the orange tree (if only the weather was nicer we could literally spend all our time there) nice little touches (Etro products in the bathroom, and every day a different gift from the management - prosecco, wine, etc-) the view from the veranda (Piazza Venezia) is extraordinary -especially on a sunny day- all the staff (Hildur, Helvire, Glenn) were excellent to all our requests and tried their best all the time without a single complaint location wise, the area is very Roman and residential -even if 3-4minutes walk from the Roman Forum-, very quiet and if you get accustomed to the metro it is only 5 minutes of quiet walk from there. it takes 10-15 minutes walking to the other main attractions, and maybe a taxi ride to main shopping area of the Spanish steps breakfast was nice, not hotel like with variations, but very well catered for. a slight dissapointment is the afternoon food which could be much better (i thought it was always the same, with whatever was left from the breakfast) otherwise a great place to stay, a warm staff, and immaculate service

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Find!”
Reviews.Author: Simps0n
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior room in The Inn At the Roman Forum for three nights and on arrival was advised that someone had taken ill and needed our room for a little longer and would we like to move to the View at the Spanish Steps (see other review) where we would be put up in the penthouse and for our last night to come back to the Inn at the Roman Forum where we were given the Garden Suite. Well what can I say, the room was very nice with vaulted ceiling and your own private garden! Lovely and just like the pictures on the website. I believe that you could have arranged to have breakfast outside but weather although sunny, was freezing. In fact, reckon it was warmer in Scotland so come prepared if travelling at this time of year! Would I have paid full price for this room which for the time we were there was 440 euros mm difficult! We are speaking Italy here and this room although not the biggest I have stayed in is certainly about my second favourite, my favourite being a hotel up from the American Embassy in Prague (another small one by coincidence) and we travel a lot staying in only four star or above. This is the second time we have chosen a small hotel as opposed to a larger oppulent one and I was very pleasantly surprised. We don't really care if the staff are friendly or not as long as they are efficient, however they were both. The hotel picks you up at the airport which is a real plus as saves struggling to find it especially at night. Very impressive location, I feel the Roman Forum area is a great place to stay as you are literally 300 yards or so from the Coluseum and the Metro (only has two lines) but saves your feet after a long day's sightseeing so everywhere worth seeing is within easy reach. Everything is within walking distance though but not lots of restaurants and bars right at the hotel but a few within five minutes walk. Would I go back - absolutely, oh and also hotel serves hot food at breakfast as well as continental option which was nice, buffet in the afternoon was ok but certainly wouln't rush back for it if doing something else as drinks are not free and was charged 6 euros for a cup of tea! No such thing as a free buffet ha ha! Altogether a great little hotel, an impressive location especially if you can afford the suite!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique stylish accommodation in central Rome location”
Reviews.Author: neb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in Rome. Got a room upgrade upon arrival, to the room with the oversized light hanging over the bed (wich itself is very large). A decent sized room (for Rome standards), great jacuzzi bath with Etro bath products supplied. No view from the room. Enjoy breakfast out on the roof terrace, looking across the rooftops of Rome. Service at the hotel was superb, helping with restaurant bookings and train times. Visit the hotel's own Forum ruins in the basement. This hotel has what must be the longest chandelier I have ever seen, hanging through the entire height of the hotel. Quite impressive! Unfortunately the fire alarm was triggered at 3am one night, so were forced out of our rooms in our sleepwear.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful retreat”
Reviews.Author: Njal
Reviews.Content: The street and the hotel are quiet - I am a light sleeper, and the only noise we heard was an occasional door shutting in the hotel and the furniture being set up on the rooftop terrace. The location is excellent - we walked to almost everywhere in Rome. There are also good restaurants nearby - Oscar Wine has wonderful and rare local products. The breakfast buffet had both protein and wonderful pastries. Room service is limited but we had a light lunch under the orange tree in the rear garden - magical. My back hurt one day and the hotel located an excellent masseur who came and put me back on my feet. When you arrive bring the map from the hotel web site. The back street on which the hotel stands has steps in it which means few cab drivers have driven on it. Otherwise ask the cab to take you to the Piazza del Grillo, a few yards from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Your private home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: coolmama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for our 20th anniversery and loved it. As mentioned previousely, don't expect a lavish reception area, you don't need it. I did alot a research prior and decided on a char!ming boutique property over the grand contenental 5-stay style holel, and this did not let down. As a point of reference, we spent around $20,000 on this 10 day trip to Rome and Amalfi coast. I say this to give you perspective on our level of travel and expectations. I booked the master garden suite and they included an airport transfer. Having that private garden made our stay magical and I am glad that we did it, it was worth every penny if you can do it. There is no better way to end the night than a drink in your own garden. One day they brought us a bottle of Prosecco. Another thing we liked about the Master garden suite, is it is on the top floor, next to the public living room and breakfast terrace. Many times we felt like we had our own private villa. My only criticism of the room is that it could have had a better area for dressing. An antique armoire was all there was for clothing with no drawers or seperate area. At this price, you should not have to have your suitcases laid out on the floor! None the less, the room was gorgeous in every way, kind of hip antique style. Service and breakfast was consistantly good, especially the fritatta. The private ruins on site was a selling point for us as well. Staying here, we felt we had a very unique taste of Rome. One of the restaurants , Hildur recommended, Trattoria de Monti was our favorite meal in Rome. Lively and trendy setting with great updated food. Make sure to get a table in the room with the glass walled kitchen. We never had trouble getting cabs. After checking out the Inn at Spanish Steps, we are glad we chose the RF. I at the RF was in a quiet, but central location. We were able to walk everywhere. While we were there we had a fabulous private guide, Rosanna and a private driver, Stefano. We wanted to take Rosanna home with us. They made the trip unique and special. They were hired through Romanstrolls.com. Also, their prices were great compared with others. I am one to always want to try something new, but I would not hesitate to return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “nice small hotel in the centre of historical Rome”
Reviews.Author: ASP2
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon at this hotel. We were disappointed when we arrived to be put into the wrong room type, expecially as we were paying alot of money! However the hotel sent up a bottle of prosecco and upgraded us to an even better room on the second night. The location is good. They booked an excellent restaurant for us which we would never have found ourselves. Breakfast was good. I wouldn't recommend their car service from the airport, it was expensive and in a dirty old car, not what we were expecting! Overall a good boutique hotel, if a little expensive for their ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “A haven around the corner from the hubub of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: ToriMold
Reviews.Content: 26th - 29th August '07.My parents and I recently returned from our 3 night visit to Rome and stayed here - what a fantastic experience. We knew where to find it as I printed off a Google map and we arrived on foot from the Metro, just about walkable. The weather was some of the hottest I have ever experienced and I have been around the world many times and stayed in many top class hotels and this was among my top ever. I cannot fault it. The breakfast on the terrace at 0630 was perfect - selection of fresh fruit, cereals, juices, pastries plus a hot buffet selection. The terrace overlooks the Forum rooftops and is so peaceful first thing in the morning. We saw Rome on foot and this location is ideal. We hopped on the Metro for the Vatican - Tip: join the tour from the people that approach you in the line - saved us queing up for hours and was a brilliant way to get info and picked out interesting facts otherwise unnoticed. We ended up getting reception to call us cabs as it was far too hot to walk but then walked back taking in various sights later in the day. The Villa Borghese is incredible, the marble sculptures and mosaics breath taking. Hotel staff very approachable and helpful. Rooms sumptuous and cater for every comfort. Bathroom with jacuzzi for tired limbs. One suggestion for the hotel is not to change the towels so frequently (ours done 3 times in one day!) to be more "Enviromentally friendly". The afternoon snacks from 5pm to 8pm are a great welcome return from a dayssight seeing. We took ours at the sister hotel at the spanish steps one time and realised then how supreme our Inn was in comparison - so noisy and inferior to the Inn. I thoroughly recommend this intimate tranquil hotel to anyone visiting Rome and hope to return next time.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT place!”
Reviews.Author: twilson140
Reviews.Content: I don't know if we could ever find nicer, more helpful people anywhere in the world than we found at the Inn at the Roman Forum! Located near the end of a little dead end street only a few very short blocks from the Colosseum and the Roman Forum, the Inn is very small and I think the only way to find it is to already know where it is! Thank goodness the package included a driver to pick up up at the airport. Having arrived fairly early in the morning, we did not expect our rooms to be ready and they were not. However, we were warmly greeted and given a tour of the part of the hotel where there are ancient ruins and remnants of one of the forums - I believe it was a part of the Trajan Forum, but don't hold me to that! I found this to be just extraordinary. We were further given a tour of the Inn and we were able to enjoy a cappuccino while sitting on the cozy outdoor terrace on the top floor overlooking Rome. There was some construction work being done nearby, which made things a little noisy now and then, but nothing disruptive. Otherwise, the Inn is situated in a very pleasant neighborhood where we never felt threatened by anything. All in all, I would never hesitate to stay at this Inn again. Because we spent most of out time sightseeing, we didn't use the rooms or other amenities all that much. However, the rooms were very comfortable and well-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Special Roman Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Treslabs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at the Roman Forum on our last night in Italy, and wish we had time to stay a few more nights! Tucked away in a small street near the Roman Forum, the hotel is less than a year old, but is located in wonderful old building. The rooms were clean and luxuriously modern (the jacuzzi bathtub was such a nice addition, since we found a jacuzzi to be quite a rarity in Italian hotels). The location can't be beat for purposes of the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Borghese Gallery, etc. The hotel is charming, and only 12 rooms. The small staff was very helpful and accomodating. Yes, there actually are ruins connected to the hotel, and archeologists are working to unearth and restore (nothing noisy). It appears that the current building abuts a former Roman aristocrat's home that includes wonderful artifacts, columns, tiles, etc. The manager was more than happy to let us wander around and take photos. While ruins are abundant in Rome, it was so special to have access to some "private" ruins, that are just now being explored! We took a taxi to the airport the next morning -- only about 40 minutes. Such a nice alternative to staying at one of the non-descript hotels near the airport. We would love to return and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaDCTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Italy, where we spent three nights at the Inn at the Roman Forum -- 2 nights on the front end of our trip, and 1 night before flying home. We first learned about the hotel through Small Luxury Hotels, and booked it after reading good reviews on the Trip Advisor site. Prior to our arrival, we contacted the hotel by email to arrange car service from the airport. They confirmed the arrangements for us (58 euros payable in cash to the driver), and also noted that there could be an additional charge if we were delayed. As it turns out, our flight arrived about an hour late, but the driver was still waiting for us exactly where promised, and he delivered us to the hotel without any additional fees. On top of that, we were thrilled to learn that they had a room ready for us upon arrival, even though we got to the hotel about 10:30 a.m. on a Friday. That was welcome news after an overnight flight, and we very much appreciated being about the shower and refresh before heading out for a day of exploring the city. The first room we stayed in was located on the first floor, and was very nicely appointed. The iPod docking station was a particularly nice touch, as well as the bathroom amentities. Perhaps my only complaint about this room was the noise that we got from the hallway as people went in and out at night or in the morning. That shouldn't be a problem for those on any of the other floors. The second room we stayed in at the end of our trip was located on the rooftop level with a terrace opening out to the enclosed courtyard. This room was absolutely beautiful, even boasting an exposed brick floor. While there was no external noise from this room, the walls seemed to be extremely thin, as we could hear the people in the neighboring room cough all night long. Other than that, we really didn't have any complaints. The rooftop terrace is a delightful place to enjoy a cocktail and snack in the later afternoon after sightseeing and before heading out for dinner. It's also a great place to start your day with breakfast. As previous reviewers have noted, the hotel's location is on a small side street that we could never have found on our own. In addition to its proximity to the Colosseum and the Forum, it is easily within walking distance or a short cab ride to almost all of the ancient Rome attractions. Once you round the corner to the hotel, it's like being in your own little corner of the city without the noise and traffic, which was definitely a plus. The staff was very friendly, and ready to help whenever we needed something. We did have some problems the two times they called a cab for us, but the problems were on the taxi/traffic end of things, and were not the hotel's fault. In fact, we found it was just as easy to walk down the hill and around the corner to the Hotel Forum and catch a cab there. One caveat on the cab drivers in the city: while most of them are very pleasant and honest people, you will occasionally find one who is not. We had one driver palm the $20 bill my husband gave him and claim he had only handed him a $5. My husband promptly pulled out the additional money he thought he owed, along with a tip, then as I got out of the cab on the driver's side, I saw him pull the $20 out from underneath the pile of money. He looked up at me, smiled, and promptly pulled away. We travel quite a bit and are usually much more cautious about things like this. I can only attribute it to jet lag and a long day of exploring. Finally, initially we had concerns about staying in the city the night before flying out. Then again, we decided that we would much rather spend our last night of vacation enjoying what we could of the city. Again, we used the hotel's car service, and the driver was there promptly as scheduled on Monday morning. We even had time for a light breakfast before leaving, as the hotel's breakfast buffet opens around 6:30 or 6:45 a.m. We made it to the airport in plenty of time, and wouldn't hesitate to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Like having your own Villa in the heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn at the Roman Forum for three nights during the beginning of May, 2007. The hotel was a little difficult to find, as the local streets were closed for May Day and the taxi could only get us as close as a few blocks from the hotel. I had read some other reviews about going up a street, then a narrower street, so with that in mind I had no problems finding the place. My suggestion, look at it on Google Maps or Google Earth first and you'll understand how to find it! Check in was prompt, even though we arrived around 10am, and we were given a beautiful king room. From what I'd heard of other properties in Rome, I was expecting two things: 1) a lot of traffic noise - none here - not a single sound of a car the entire time since this hotel is located on a tiny street that rarely gets cars, and 2) a tiny, tiny, tiny room - not here - the room was HUGE with a large bathroom that had both a jacuzzi tub and a separate amazing rainfall shower. The gardens are amazing, the breakfast/living room is gorgeous, the view is breath-taking. There are 2,000+ year old ruins located on the first floor of the hotel, and you can explore them whenever you want. The location is perfect, you can walk to anything within minutes, and within 30 seconds you are at the ancient trajan markets, the tomb of the unknown soldier, and within about 3 minutes you can be at the coliseum. A lot of people want to stay by the Spanish steps - but I think that's an over-rated location - noisy, touristy, commercial. The staff is wonderful - I had a long conversation with the GM, as well as many of the staff members - they were all wonderful, and truly have a passion for what they do in life. The best way to describe the Inn at the Roman Forum is "perfect". It's a very exclusive property that makes you feel like you're living in your own mansion located in the middle of a great city - you are taken care of when you want to be taken care of, then suddenly you can be on your own in the gardens or on the terrace, enjoying the company of your traveling companion. Please, feel free to contact me with any questions you may have!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon start”
Reviews.Author: Ethelita
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon at the Inn at the Roman Forum, three wonderful and very comfortable nights. The service was personalized, helpful, friendly and "stop anything they were doing to take care of us". They were happy for us to take a laptop to the room for checking internet - very handy! Its a small hotel so faces become familiar very quickly - which is nice! The room was perfect - absolutely no complaints. We had a nice jacuzzi, a nice fireplace, and a superb bed! The roof terrace is georgeous - we had long breakfasts with a magnificent view. The hotel is actually connected to the Roman Forum - so the location is perfect to walk to Piazza Venezia and the Coliseum. The quietness in the middle of a touristic spot was very valuable (you wake up with the bird songs in the morning!). Restaurant recommendations were also fantastic! Do ask them about little cozy restaurants in the little streets close to the hotel (rather than the touristic areas). Breakfast was good, but we think they can do this bit better! The price/value may be a bit overpriced (but not much).

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: murphthesurf
Reviews.Content: This is a special place. The centrally located hotel has only 12 rooms. It has a terrace overlooking the rooftops in ancient Rome. The staff is the best we have ever encountered. The food is unbelievable and the rooms are sensational. The small cobble stone street leading to the hotel makes you wonder what you are getting into but once you enter and go upstairs it keeps getting better and better. No need or room for a car but prepare to do some walking and stay alert because the drivers are bold.

HotelInfo.Name: Inn at the Roman Forum
HotelInfo.Address: Via degli Ibernesi 30, 00184 Rome, Italy
